results.content: It's a good course to understand the basics of Angular 1.6 with .NET Web API. Presented in a nice way of encountering errors and resolving them (Real world experience). Could have explained a little bit more on why did he add some properties/methods in file upload because a beginner may find it hard to understand how and why some stuff are needed.

response.content: Thanks for your honest review. I will describe those in details in next update.

results.content: it is very difficult to understand the presenter.

response.content:
There are 21 more reviews and no one complaint that my lecture is not understandable. 

There is a simple solution udemy supports. If you think any course is not suitable for you then you can leave the course. 

We, instructors, work very hard to create a course cause teaching is our passion and some people like you come and leave a worse comment and review and destroy an instructors mentality to add more contents.

I request you, please leave my course as this course is not suitable for you. Buy some other course which is suitable for you. It will both save your money and time.

Wish your prosperous professional life. Happy coding.

results.content:
This course, so far, is jumping right in to the use of AngularJS and how it works with in HTML pages.  It is fast passed and has given me several points to review in my understanding of HTML page configuration with AngularJS driving the back end.

I like to push the edge of my understanding and this has me reviewing what I thought I knew and how Angular can improve it. B-}
